name: Oklahoma Tax Commission v. Citizen Band, Potawatomi Indian Tribe of Oklahoma
Business Guides, Inc. v. Chromatic Communications Enterprises, Inc.
FMC Corporation v. Holliday
question: Does ERISA preempt the Pennsylvania law precluding employee welfare benefit plans from exercising subrogation rights on a claimant's tort recovery?

name: International Organization of Masters, Mates & Pilots v. Brown
Lampf, Pleva, Lipkind, Prupis & Petigrow v. Gilbertson
Eastern Airlines, Inc. v. Floyd
question: Does Article 17 of the Warsaw Convention, which states that an international air carrier may be held liable for injuries of a passenger, allow recovery for mental or psychic injuries unaccompanied or manifested by physical injury?
description: A case in which the Court held that Article 17 of the Warsaw Convention does not allow recovery for purely mental injuries.

name: Irwin v. Department of Veterans Affairs
question: Does the 30-day window after "receipt of notice of final action taken" by the EEOC within which a suit against the federal government must be filed begin when an attorney's office receives notification, or when the attorney or client himself receives notification?

name: California v. Hodari D.
question:
(1) Has a person who is not under the physical control of a police officer been "seized" under the Fourth Amendment when the officer is chasing that person?

(2) Can a person who is pursued by a police officer avoid prosecution by discarding incriminating evidence and asserting that he did so out of fear of an unlawful search?

name: West Virginia University Hospitals, Inc. v. Casey
McNary v. Haitian Refugee Center, Inc.
Norfolk & Western Railway Company v. American Train Dispatchers Association
Harmelin v. Michigan
question: Is a statutorily mandated sentence that does not allow for consideration of mitigating factors a violation of the Eighth Amendment's protection against cruel and unusual punishments?

name: Wilson v. Seiter
question: Did the United States Court of Appeals for the Sixth Circuit err by holding that prison officials must have a "culpable state of mind" in order to establish cruel and unusual punishment of an inmate? Did the Court of Appeals err by overlooking an inmate's claim that prison officials showed "deliberate indifference" to his conditions of confinement?

name: Chisom v. Roemer
question: Does the 1982 amendment to section 2 of the Voting Rights Act apply to judicial elections?

name: Ford Motor Credit Co. v. Department of Revenue of Fla.
American Hospital Association v. National Labor Relations Board
McNeil v. Wisconsin
question: Does the accused's invocation of the Sixth Amendment's provision of legal counsel for one charge also invoke the Fifth Amendment's right to counsel for unrelated offenses charged later?

name: Board of Education of Oklahoma City Public Schools v. Dowell
question: If a federal court deems that an injunction to desegregate schools has achieved its goals, can that court permanently dissolve the injunction?

name: Leathers v. Medlock
question: Does differential taxation of different media violate the First and 14th Amendments? Does differential taxation of members of the same medium violate the First and 14th Amendments?

name: City of Columbia v. Omni Outdoor Advertising, Inc.
Kamen v. Kemper Financial Services, Inc.
United States v. Centennial Savings Bank FSB
question: Can a bank list the exchange of properties that have equal fair market value as a loss on its federal Income Tax return if the property it loses is worth significantly less at the time of the exchange than it was when the property was initially acquired? May a bank treat money received from early withdrawal penalties as "income from the discharge ... of indebtedness" under 26 U.S.C. 108(a)(1)(C)?

name: Exxon Corporation v. Central Gulf Lines, Inc.
question: Whether a contract to procure for a vessel fuel from a third party is a maritime contract within admiralty jurisdiction and enforceable in an action in rem?

name: California v. Acevedo
question: Under the Fourth Amendment, may police conduct a warrantless search of a container within an automobile if they have probable cause to believe that the container holds evidence?
description: A case in which the Court ruled that the Fourth Amendment permits police to conduct a warrantless search of a container within an automobile if they have probable cause to believe the container holds evidence.

name: Grogan v. Garner
question: What standard of evidence should bankruptcy courts apply in considering whether a debt was the result of "actual fraud" under section 523(a) of the Bankruptcy Code?

name: Florida v. Bostick
question: Is the acquisition of evidence during random bus searches, conducted pursuant to passengers' consent, a per se violation of the Fourth Amendment's protection against unconstitutional search and seizure?

name: Touby v. United States
question:
Did the Controlled Substances Act unconstitutionally delegate legislative power to the Attorney General?

(1)Does the Act allow the Attorney General to delegate authority to the Drug Enforcement Agency?
description: A case in which the Court held that the Controlled Substances Act allows the Attorney General to delegate authority to the Drug Enforcement Agency.

name: Air Courier Conference of America v. American Postal Workers Union, AFL-CIO
Freeport-McMoRan Inc. v. K N Energy, Inc.
Blatchford v. Native Village of Noatak
International Union, United Automobile, Aerospace & Agricultural Implement Workers of America, UAW
question: Does a policy barring the participation of potentially fertile and pregnant women in occupations that could be detrimental to their reproductive capacities constitute sexual discrimination in violation of Title VII of the 1964 Civil Rights Act?

name: United States v. R. Enterprises, Inc.
Gregory v. Ashcroft
question: Did Missouri's mandatory retirement requirement for its state court judges violate the the 1967 federal Age Discrimination in Employment Act (ADEA) and the Fourteenth Amendment's Equal Protection Clause?

name: Florida v. Jimeno
question: Does a suspect's consent to a search of his vehicle extend to closed containers found inside?

name: Metropolitan Washington Airports Authority v. Citizens for the Abatement of Aircraft Noise, Inc.
Rust v. Sullivan
question: Do the regulations violate the First and Fifth Amendment rights of clients and health providers?

name: Mobil Oil Exploration & Producing Southeast, Inc. v. United Distribution Companies
Litton Financial Printing Div., Litton Business Systems, Inc. v. NLRB
Air Line Pilots Association, International v. O'Neill
Astoria Federal Savings & Loan Association v. Solimino
Payne v. Tennessee
question: Does the Eighth Amendment prohibit a capital sentencing jury from considering the impact that a victim's death had upon surviving family members?

name: Minnick v. Mississippi
question: Does Edwards v Arizona require counsel to be present with an accused during any questioning after that accused invokes his right to counsel?

name: Cohen v. Cowles Media Company
question: Does the First Amendment bar a plaintiff from recovering damages, under state promissory estoppel law, for a newspaper's breach of a promise of confidentiality?

name: Houston Lawyers' Association v. Attorney General of Texas
Palmer v. BRG of Georgia, Inc.
Feist Publications, Inc. v. Rural Telephone Service Company, Inc.
question: Does the copyright in a telephone company's directory protect the names, towns, and telephone numbers copied by another telephone directory company?

name: Virginia Bankshares, Inc.  v. Sandberg
question: First, can a proxy statement couched in conclusory or qualitative terms, such as "high value," purporting to explain the directors' reasons for recommending a corporate action, be materially misleading within the meaning of Rule 14a-9? Second, can causation of damages compensable under Section 14(a) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, 15 U.S.C. Section 78n(a), be shown by members of a class of minority shareholders whose votes are not required by law or corporate bylaw to authorize the corporate action subject to the proxy solicitation?

name: Freytag v. Commissioner
question: Does 26 U.S.C. 7443A(a) permit the assignment of particularly complex cases dealing with large amounts of money to "special trial judges" appointed by the Chief Judge of the U.S. Tax Court, provided that the special trial judges do not enter the decision but simply prepare an opinion for review and adoption by a regular Tax Court judge? Under the Appointments Clause of Article II Section 2, may Congress permit the Chief Judge of the U.S. Tax Court to appoint "special trial judges" to "any other proceeding which the chief judge may designate"?

name: Schad v. Arizona
question: Does the Due Process Clause of the 14th Amendment require juries in capital cases to be instructed on every lesser offense, includeding non-capital offenses, (e.g., robbery) that are supported by the evidence?

name: Arcadia, Ohio v. Ohio Power Company
Edmonson v. Leesville Concrete Company, Inc.
Pacific Mutual Life Insurance Company v. Haslip
James M. Beam Distilling Company v. Georgia
Trinova Corporation v. Michigan Department of Treasury
United States v. Louisiana (Alabama and Mississippi Boundary Case)
Barnes v. Glen Theatre Inc.
question: Does a state prohibition against complete nudity in public places violate the First Amendment's freedom of expression guarantee?

name: Arizona v. Fulminante
question:
1. Did the Arizona Supreme Court properly apply the totality of circumstances test when considering whether a suspect's confession to murder was coerced?

2. Did the Arizona Supreme Court properly apply harmless error analysis when considering whether the suspect's coerced confession influenced the trial outcome?

name: Cottage Savings Association v. Commissioner of Internal Revenue
question: Can the exchange of properties considered "substantially identical" for accounting purposes under Federal Home Loan Bank Board regulations be considered a "disposition of property" for IRS tax purposes, given that properties exchanged must be materially different to constitute a "disposition" under section 1001(a) of Title 26 of the tax code?

name: Gentile v. State Bar of Nevada
Groves v. Ring Screw Works, Ferndale Fastener Division
Riverside County v. McLaughlin
question: Did Riverside violate the Court's holding in Gerstein v. Pugh (420 U.S. 103), which required prompt probable cause determinations?

name: Martin v. Occupational Safety and Health Review Commission
FirsTier Mortgage Company v. Investors Mortgage Insurance Company
International Primate Protection League v. Administrators, Tulane Educational Fund
Equal Employment Opportunity Commission v. Arabian American Oil Company
Masson v. New Yorker Magazine, Inc.
question: Does the First Amendment give the New Yorker a right to publish fabricated quotations attributed to a public figure?

name: Powers v. Ohio
question: Does the Equal Protection Clause of the Fourteenth Amendment of the United States Constitution and Article 1 sections 10 and 16 of the Ohio Constitution allow a criminal defendant to make objections to race-based exclusions of jurors by the State during the jury selection process if the defendant and the jurors are of different races?
description: A case in which the Court that the prosecution is prohibited from excluding an unbiased and qualified juror based on the person’s race regardless of the race of the defendant.

name: Carnival Cruise Lines, Inc. v. Shute
